Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.io

Class XMLEditor

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.io.XMLEditor
public class XMLEditor
extends Object
This class is used for read and write access to data which is stored in XML format.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Constructor that is used to create a new instance of this object with a given file, defined by the argument fullPath.
    XMLEditor​(String fullPath, String rootNode)

  • Constructor Details

    • XMLEditor

      public XMLEditor​(File xml_src)
      Constructor that is used to create a new instance of this object with a given file-object, defined by the argument xml_src. After creating an instance with this constructor, immediate read and write access can be performed to the xml file, using the methods provided by this class.
      Parameters:
      xml_src - Object of type File

    • XMLEditor

      public XMLEditor​(String fullPath, String rootNode)

    • XMLEditor

      public XMLEditor​(String fullPath)
      Constructor that is used to create a new instance of this object with a given file, defined by the argument fullPath. After creating an instance with this constructor, immediate read and write access can be performed to the xml file, using the methods provided by this class.
      Parameters:
      fullPath - String with the relative or absolute path and filename of the xml file

    • XMLEditor

    • addElement

      public Element addElement​(String xPath, String elementName, String elementValue, String attributeName, String attributeValue)

    • addTag

      public void addTag​(Element entry)
      Adds a child tag to the root tag of the XML document which is represented by the current instance of the doc property. This method will immediately write the tag into the physical XML file which is represented by the doc property, using the save() Method.
      Parameters:
      entry - The XML tag as type Element that will be added to the root element of the current XML Document

    • addTag

      public void addTag​(String tagName)
      Add an element to the root element by using the newElement() without attribute.
      Parameters:
      tagName - the tag name

    • addTag

      public void addTag​(String tagName, HashMap<String,​String> attributes)
      Adds a child tag with one or more attributes to the root tag of the XML document which is represented by the current instance of the doc property. This method will immediately write the tag into the physical XML file which is represented by the doc property, using the save() Method.
      Parameters:
      tagName - Name of the XML tag
      attributes - HashMap containing attributes with their names as keys

    • addTag

      public void addTag​(String tagName, String attributeName, String attributeValue)
      Add an element to the root element by using the newElement() method with one attribute.
      Parameters:
      tagName - the tag name
      attributeName - name of the attribute as String
      attributeValue - value of the attribute as String

    • checkXPath

      public Element checkXPath​(String XPath, boolean createMissingNodes)

    • compareElements

      public boolean compareElements​(Element eSearch, Element eCompareWith)

    • createElement

      public Element createElement​(String tagName)
      Creates and returns a new object instance of type Element without attributes for further operations like adding the element to the root tag of an XML document, shown in the following sample where a new tag with the name newTag will be added to the root tag of XML file c:\\temp\\sample.xml: 
       XMLEditor xmlEdit = new XMLEditor(new File("c:\\temp\\sample.xml"));
 Element newE = xmlEdit.createElement("newTag");
 xmlEdit.addElement(newE);
      The result can look like this: 
       <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <rootTag> <newTag/>
 </rootTag>
      Parameters:
      tagName - Name of a new XML tag that will be represented by the created Element
      Returns:
      new object of type Element

    • createElement

      public Element createElement​(String tagName, HashMap<String,​String> attributes)
      Creates and returns a new object instance of type Element one or multiple attributes for further operations, like adding the element to the root tag of an XML document, shown in the following sample where a new tag with the name newTag will be added to the root tag of XML file c:\\temp\\sample.xml: 
       XMLEditor xmlEdit = new XMLEditor(new File("c:\\temp\\sample.xml"));
 HashMap<String, String> attrMap = new HashMap<>();
 Element newE = xmlEdit.createElement("newTag", attrMap);
 xmlEdit.addElement(newE);
      The result can look like this: 
       <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <rootTag> <newTag
 name="SampleText">/ </rootTag>
      Parameters:
      tagName - Name of a new XML tag that will be represented by the created Element
      attributes - HashMap containing attributes with their names as keys
      Returns:
      new object of type Element

    • createElement

      public Element createElement​(String tagName, String attributeName, String attributeValue)
      Creates and returns a new object instance of type Element one attribute for further operations, like adding the element to the root tag of an XML document, shown in the following sample where a new tag with the name newTag will be added to the root tag of XML file c:\\temp\\sample.xml: 
       XMLEditor xmlEdit = new XMLEditor(new File("c:\\temp\\sample.xml"));
 Element newE = xmlEdit.createElement("newTag", "name", "SampleText");
 xmlEdit.addElement(newE);
      The result can look like this: 
       <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <rootTag> <newTag
 name="SampleText">/ </rootTag>
      Parameters:
      tagName - Name of a new XML tag that will be represented by the created Element
      attributeName - name of the attribute as String
      attributeValue - value of the attribute as String
      Returns:
      new object of type Element

    • delElement

      public void delElement​(Element target)
      Removes the specified element from the XML file.
      Parameters:
      target - the Element that should be removed. Retrieve via getElement().

    • delElement

      public void delElement​(String tagName, HashMap<String,​String> attributes)
      Delete a element by tag name and attribute.
      Parameters:
      tagName - the tag name
      attributes - the target element's attributes

    • delElement

      public void delElement​(String tagName, String attributeName, String attributeValue)
      Delete a element by tag name and attribute.
      Parameters:
      tagName - the tag name
      attributeName - the target's attributeName for identification
      attributeValue - the target's attributeValue for identification

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getChild

      public Element getChild​(Element parent, String tagName)
      Retrieve a child element by it's parent, applicable to the specified tag name. If there can be more than one child use getChildren instead.
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent element
      tagName - the child's tag name
      Returns:
      The found element or null if nothing could be found

    • getChild

      public Element getChild​(Element parent, String tagName, String attrName, String attrValue)
      Retrieve a child element by it's parent, applicable to the specified tag name and attribute value.
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent element
      tagName - the child's tag name
      attrName - the child's attribute name
      attrValue - the child's attribute value
      Returns:
      The found element or null if nothing could be found

    • getChildren

      public ArrayList<Element> getChildren​(Element parent)
      Retrieve a list of all the parent's child elements.
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent element
      Returns:
      The found elements or an empty list if nothing could be found.

    • getDocument

      public Document getDocument()

    • getElement

      public Element getElement​(String exp)
      Get Element by XPath expression. In case of multiple occurrences of the XPath within the XML file, the method will retrieve the element of the first occurrence.
      Parameters:
      exp - XPath referencing to the searched element
      Returns:
      the found element

    • getElement

      public Element getElement​(Element target)
      Get Element by using a newly created target element. Use getElementByParent instead if the element is not unique.
      Parameters:
      target - the element to search for
      Returns:
      the referring element in the xml-file

    • getElement

      public Element getElement​(Element parent, Element searchChild)

    • getElement

      public Element getElement​(String tagName, String attributeName, String attributeValue)
      Get Element by using tagName and attribute (only if it is unique).
      Parameters:
      tagName - the tagName of the target element
      attributeName - the attributeName of the searched element
      attributeValue - the attributeValue of the searched element
      Returns:
      the found element

    • getElement

      public Element getElement​(String tagName, HashMap<String,​String> attributes)
      Get Element by using tagName and attribute (only if it is unique).
      Parameters:
      tagName - the tagName of the target element
      attributes - the attributes of the searched element
      Returns:
      the found element

    • getElementsList

      public ArrayList<Element> getElementsList​(String tagName)
      Retrieve a list of all applicable elements.
      Parameters:
      tagName - the element's tag name
      Returns:
      A list with all the suitable elements.

    • getElementsList

      public ArrayList<Element> getElementsList​(String tagName, boolean ignoreChildless)
      Retrieve a list of all applicable elements. If ignoreChildless is true, child-less elements will be ignored.
      Parameters:
      tagName - the element's tag name
      ignoreChildless - child-less elements will be ignored, if true
      Returns:
      A list with all the suitable elements.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      index of the element

      public Element getParent​(Element target)
      Get the parent of the referenced element.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The parent element

    • getRoot

      public Element getRoot()
      Retrieves the root element of the xml file for this instance of XMLEditor. The rootElement property will be assigned by the method createXMLEditor() with the root element of the assigned XML-file. If the assigned XML-file does not exist, a new root element will be created with a default name.
      Returns:
      an object of type Element, representing the root element of the assigned XML-file
      See Also:
      Element

    • getTargetElement

      public Element getTargetElement​(String xPath)

    • getText

      public String getText​(String exp)
      Get element value by XPath expression.
      Parameters:
      exp - XPath referencing to the searched element
      Returns:
      the value of the found element

    • getValue

      public String getValue​(Element parent)

    • getXMLFile

      public File getXMLFile()
      Returns the current value of property xmlFile as object of type File.
      Returns:
      The current value of property xmlFile.

    • getXmlTags

      public List<String> getXmlTags()
      This method returns all XML tags used in the XML file by calling another instance of this method with a list of all elements on the top level and an empty one, used for recursive calls.
      Returns:
      List containing all XML tags used in the XML file

    • getXPaths

      public List<String> getXPaths​(String tag)
      Returns a list of all XPaths, referencing to a element with the passed tag.
      Parameters:
      tag - String with the tag reference
      Returns:
      List containing all referencing XPaths

    • isXPath

      public boolean isXPath​(String exp)
      Check if the String expression is a XPath (currently only checks for a slash character at the beginning)
      Parameters:
      exp - XPath expression
      Returns:
      true if the expression is a XPath (starts with a slash character)

    • readXPath

      public String readXPath​(String exp)
      If the passed element, referenced by an XPath, has attributes, this method returns those by combining attribute name and value. Otherwise if the element has a text value, this method returns the value.
      Parameters:
      exp - String with the XPath reference
      Returns:
      String containing the attributes or value

    • replaceElement

      public void replaceElement​(Element oldEl, Element newEl)
      Replaces the old Element with a new Element at the same hierarchical position.
      Parameters:
      oldEl - the old Element
      newEl - the new Element

    • save

      public void save()
      Write out results of the XMLEditor to the related file.

    • save

      public void save​(String fileName)

    • save

      public void save​(File xmlOut)

    • setElementValue

      public Element setElementValue​(Element el, String val)
      Set the TextValue of the element. Use only for elements without children, if it has any they will be deleted.
      Parameters:
      el - the element reference to the element that should be changed
      val - new TextValue
      Returns:
      the changed element
